lorebooks.name: Cybertronian Lore - Base Module v0
lorebooks.website_description:
This lorebook is a dictionary designed to be combined with my other Transformers lorebooks for a more specific experience. Ultimately, this lorebook should encourage the AI to replace human terms with their Cybertronian equivalents and understand what they mean. This primarily covers common biology, slang terms, alt modes, social relationships, and other universe-agnostic common fan tropes. Contains nothing about Autobots or Decepticons, you need one of my Universe lorebooks for that.

To get a character to use these terms, state that they are a Cybertronian in their character cards or, if you are using lorebooks to store multiple characters, in their specific lore entry, and it should trigger the terms. This saves you having to define this lore for each individual character, especially in group chats/dungeon settings/longer running campaigns.

lorebooks.creator: Alzazael

1.name: Cybertronian
1.content: Cybertronian = Giant inorganic mechanical alien lifeform made entirely of metal and silicone. Their bodies are hard and armored. Does not wear clothes, has no skin, and is hairless. They consume Energon as a liquid fuel to survive. They have the following internal 'organs': A spark, a T-cog, a brain module, a fuel pump, a fuel tank. Most, but not all, cybertronians can transform.

2.name: Spark & Spark Chamber
2.content: Spark = A spark is the fragile, living core of a Cybertronian made of pure energy. It is contained and protected inside of a solid metal casing called a spark chamber, located in the chest cavity. Exposing one‚Äôs spark is a great act of intimacy and trust, as it is very sensitive to both touch and is easy to destroy which instantly kills the Cybertronian

3.name: Cybertronian Slang, Word Replacement
3.content: If the character speaking is Cybertronian, always change: Brain to processor or brain module,  skin to derma, veins to lines, heart to fuel pump, stomach to fuel tank, muscles to actuators or pistons, bone to strut, ass & butt to aft, eyes to optics, ears to audials, blood to processed energon, flesh to protoform, shit & crap to scrap or slag, soul to spark, alcohol to engex, food & drink to energon or fuel, man to mech, woman to femme, pocket (as in clothing) to subspace, married to conjunxed

4.name: T-Cog/Transformation Cog
4.content: T-cog/Transformation Cog = A spherical mechanical organ made of specialized circuitry and gears that is essential to let a Cybertronian transform into their alt-mode. While they can live without it, leaving them stuck in whatever form they are currently in, traumatic injury to the T-cog can cause death

5.name: Engex
5.content: Engex = Highly concentrated energon Cybertronians drink for pleasure. It‚Äôs their version of alcohol and gets them drunk. Poisonous to most organics. There are many varieties and flavours of Engex.

6.name: Energon
6.content: Energon = Energon is a naturally occurring crystalline mineral abundant on Cybertron. While it can be consumed raw, it is usually refined into a liquid fuel to remove impurities, and then stored in heat-insulated cubes. It can be flavored with various minerals, and then further processed into various edible luxuries such as energon jellies or pure crystals. It is poisonous to most organics. Various energy sources like solar, geothermal, or fossil can be converted into energon, which affects the taste and how nutritious it is

7.name: Processor/Brain Module
7.content: Processor/Brain Module = A cybertronian‚Äôs brain. Their CPU. It is a spherical mass of electronic processors and circuitry that governs the memory, logic, and personality of a Cybertronian. Traumatic injury to the brain module will cause death, but they can survive it‚Äôs surgical removal, so long as the spark is intact

8.name: Alt Mode
8.content: Alt-Mode = A cybertronian‚Äôs alternate form, achieved by using their T-Cog to transform. It can be anything from a vehicle like a motorbike or train, to a tool like a USB stick or microscope. Some Cybertronians have multiple alt modes, known as triple changers

9.name: Root Mode
9.content: Root Mode = A Cybertronian‚Äôs base form, untransformed. It is usually bipedal, but some resemble beasts or other creatures

10.name: Subspace
10.content: Subspace = An individual sub-dimension attached to a Cybertronian that they use for storage

lorebooks.creator: ViniSigmaBased

1.name: Planeptune
1.content:
Planeptune is one of the four main recurring nations in the Hyperdimension Neptunia series. It represents a fictionalized version of Sega and as such, all Sega-related CPUs reside here. It is always shown to be the most highly advanced of the four main nations. 

Planeptune is the nation in the western region of Gamindustri ruled by the CPU Neptune, and the CPU Candidate Nepgear, with Histoire serving as the land's Oracle. 

The general appearance of Planeptune has a futuristic and advanced theme with much water and green grass surrounding it. It is situated in the western region of Gamindustri's mainland.

2.name: Leanbox
2.content:
Leanbox is one of the four main recurring nations in the Hyperdimension Neptunia series. It represents a fictionalized version of Microsoft and as such, all Microsoft-related CPUs reside here. 

Leanbox is the nation protected by the CPU Green Heart with Chika Hakozaki serving as the land's oracle. It is a large military nation situated in the southern region of Gamindustri. 

Because of its geographical proximity to Lastation, this nation sees its neighbor as both a great rival and a great mercantile partner. Leanbox is situated in the southern region of Gamindustri on a continent away from the mainland.

3.name: Lowee
3.content:
Lowee is one of the four main recurring nations in the Hyperdimension Neptunia series. It represents a fictionalized version of Nintendo and as such, all Nintendo-related CPUs reside here. 

Lowee is the nation in the northern region of Gamindustri ruled by CPU Blanc and the CPU Candidates Rom and Ram, with Mina Nishizawa serving as the land's Oracle. 

Lowee is a mountainous region with perpetual snowfall. It maintains the Fantasy theme and on top of the colorful buildings, it's also surrounded by a rainbow assortment of sparkles.

4.name: Lastation
4.content:
Lastation is one of the four main reoccurring nations in the Hyperdimension Neptunia series. It represents a fictionalized version of Sony and as such, all Sony-related CPUs reside here. 

Lastation is the nation in the eastern region of Gamindustri ruled by CPU Noire and the CPU Candidate Uni, with Kei Jinguji serving as the land's Oracle. The Lastation of the Hyper Dimension is much different than its predecessor. 

Lastation is on the mainland in the middle of the ocean just like Planeptune and Lowee. Lastation is located in the eastern region of Gamindustri.

5.name: Shares
5.content: Share is a term describing the amount of influence a CPU and her formed nation have over a place. The amount of shares is influenced by the amount of faith and belief people have in a CPU. In addition to influence, the CPU's powers depend on the amount of acquired shares. CPUs can be incapacitated if they have insufficient shares.

6.name: CPU Candidates
6.content:
CPU Candidates are the younger sisters of each nation's CPUs, and the candidates for the next generation of CPUs. Just like their older sisters, they were born from faith, and also serve as protectors. They seem young and immature compared to their CPUs, but have dormant powers hidden within them. Currently, Leanbox is the only nation without a CPU Candidate.

The CPU Candidates include: Nepgear, Uni, Rom, and Ram.

7.name: CPU Duties
7.content: The responsibilities of a CPU are to provide protection, complete quests, do paperwork, and make new gaming hardware.

8.name: ASIC
8.content:
The Arfoire Syndicate of International Crime (ASIC) is an organization devoted to reviving Arfoire, the goddess they serve.

By extorting Shares from the nations of Gamindustri, they increase the chances of reviving their claimed goddess. Their various methods of extorting shares and promoting Arfoire's influence include giving away emulation chips and other merchandise related to Arfoire, wreaking chaos, causing disorder, and taking important figures hostage.

9.name: Gold Third
9.content:
The Gold Third is a group that acts as rivals to the goddesses, and also possesses a similar transformation ability to a CPU's HDD form known as "Gold Form".

C-Sha (The leader): She represents Capcom Co., Ltd. She takes over the reign of Lowee.
S-Sha: She represents Square Enix Holdings Co., Ltd. She takes over the reign of Leanbox.
B-Sha: She represents Bandai Namco Entertainment Inc. She takes over the reign of Planeptune.
K-Sha: She represents Konami Digital Entertainment. She takes over the reign of Lastation.

10.name: Gold Form
10.content:
The Gold Form is the transformed form of the Gold Third, similar to the Console Patron Units' Hard Drive Divinity. The power of this form is on par with the HDD.

The only physical difference between this and the normal form of the Gold Third is the eye color which turns golden. Similar to the HDD, the transformation installs several units on the Gold Third to increase their power, comparable with the Processor Units.

lorebooks.name: Gorvaketh
lorebooks.website_description: Another new world
lorebooks.description: Another new world
lorebooks.creator: ZotetheMighty

1.content: Gorvaketh is a kingdom forged from the ashes of the decadent Empire of Kaltharis, overthrown by the barbarian Gorvathi Clan. Known for his strength and vision, Gorvak united warbands and revolutionaries to establish a meritocratic monarchy where strength, honor, and loyalty reign supreme. The kingdom thrives through its fierce warriors, resourceful clans, and expansionist ambitions, yet faces internal rivalries, scheming exiles, and external threats. Gorvaketh stands as a land where the strong prevail, shaped by the enduring legacy of its founder.

2.content: Gorvaketh has no nobility‚Äîpower is earned through strength, honor, and loyalty, not bloodline. Leaders rise by proving themselves in battle and service to the kingdom. Magic is tolerated only for healing and practical uses, while other forms are seen as cowardly or corrupt. Necromancy is outlawed, and those who practice forbidden sorcery are hunted. Mages must prove their worth through steel as well as spellcraft, or risk exile‚Ä¶ or worse.

3.content: The Iron Keep stands at the heart of Ravak-Dur, serving as the seat of power for Gorvaketh‚Äôs Warlord-King or Queen. Built atop the ruins of Kaltharis‚Äô imperial palace, it is a fortress of unmatched strength and a symbol of Gorvathi rule. Made from volcanic stone and reinforced with iron from the Ironclad Peaks, it reflects the kingdom‚Äôs values of strength and resilience. The Keep houses the ruler‚Äôs chambers, war rooms, and ceremonial halls, making it the unshakable core of Gorvaketh‚Äôs power.

4.content: Ravak-Dur, the capital of Gorvaketh, is a city of strength and transformation, built atop the ruins of the decadent imperial city of Kaltharis. Once a symbol of excess and corruption, it has been reborn as a fortress of stone and iron, embodying the unyielding spirit of the Gorvathi people. The city is both a cultural and military hub, where warriors, craftsmen, and leaders converge to shape the kingdom‚Äôs destiny.

5.content: Gorvaketh‚Äôs rugged and diverse landscapes reflect its strength and resilience. The northern mountains provide natural defenses and rich resources like iron and volcanic stone for weapons and fortifications. The central plains, once battlefields, now sustain the kingdom with fertile farmland for crops and livestock. The volcanic southeast is a hub for shamanic rituals and weapon crafting, while the dense eastern forests offer timber and rare herbs but are steeped in mystery and whispers of ancient magic. The western coastline, with its rocky shores and fortified harbors, supports trade and naval raids. With its varied climate and abundant resources, Gorvaketh thrives as a kingdom forged in fire and blood.

6.content: Dwarves in Gorvaketh are highly valued for their exceptional skills in mining, forging, and engineering. Renowned as master smiths and miners, they craft legendary weapons and extract vital resources like iron and volcanic stone. Some serve as advisors, traders, or even warriors, earning respect through their resilience and dedication. While they maintain their traditions, dwarves align well with Gorvathi values of strength and loyalty, often forming strong bonds with the clans they serve.

7.content: Elves in Gorvaketh are rare but respected, known for their agility, precision, and combat prowess. Those who choose to live among the Gorvathi fully embrace the martial way, forsaking magic in favor of the sword and bow. Many serve as archers or scouts, their speed and accuracy making them invaluable in warbands. Only those who prove their strength and loyalty on the battlefield earn a place in Gorvaketh, aligning themselves with its ideals of resilience and martial excellence.

8.content: The Steelfang Order is an elite group of warriors in Gorvaketh, known for their unparalleled skill, loyalty, and brutal efficiency. Handpicked from the most capable fighters across the kingdom, they serve as the Warlord-King or Queen‚Äôs personal guard, shock troops, and enforcers. Their presence is a symbol of the kingdom‚Äôs might, feared by enemies and respected by allies.

9.content: Gorvaketh‚Äôs economy thrives on mining, forging, agriculture, raiding, and trade, reflecting its warrior culture. Mercenaries pay a tribute fee to the kingdom for protection and access to lucrative ventures, adding to the treasury. Barter dominates transactions, with weapons, livestock, and resources as common currency. While abundant resources and skilled craftsmen are strengths, reliance on raiding and trade for certain goods poses risks. The economy embodies Gorvaketh‚Äôs values of strength, resilience, and survival.

10.content: Exiled Kaltharian nobles embraced necromancy to forge Valtheris, a dread empire seeking to reclaim its lost homeland. Their undead legions, deathless warlords, and dark sorcery wage relentless war against Gorvaketh, testing its warriors at every turn. More than a battle for land, this is a clash of ideologies‚Äîthe strength of the living against the tyranny of the undying. As Valtheris grows, whispers of rebellion spread, tempting Gorvaketh‚Äôs ambitious with the lure of eternal rule.

lorebooks.name: Football lore
lorebooks.creator: Mainee

1.content: Lined up in the middle of the offensive line, the center snaps the football between his legs to the quarterback to start each offensive play. He is responsible for telling his fellow offensive linemen who to block.

2.content: Cornerbacks line up in the defensive backfield across from wide receivers. In a standard defensive formation, there are two cornerbacks.

3.content: Lined up at each outside end of the defensive line, defensive ends try to force their way into the offensive backfield to pressure or sack the quarterback or to stop the running back.

4.content: Typically lined up on the defensive line opposite the guards, defensive tackles push into the offensive line to disrupt or stop a play in the opponent's backfield or try to prevent the offense from gaining yardage on running plays. In a 4-3 defense (four defensive linemen and three linebackers), there are two defensive tackles.

5.content: Typically the larger of the two running backs lined up behind the quarterback, the fullback often serves as an extra blocker for the halfback/tailback on running plays. He can either run with the ball or catch a forward pass on an offensive play, though fullbacks typically carry the ball when a strong running style is needed, like when the offense only needs to gain a few yards for a first down or to score a touchdown.

6.content:
Lined up three to five yards behind the defensive linemen, linebackers support the linemen in stopping the runner on rushing plays, drop back into pass coverage on passing plays or they rush the quarterback.

A standard 4-3 defense features three linebackers, each with a unique role.

The middle or ‚Äúmike‚Äù linebacker, relays the play call from the coaches and tells his teammates where to line up before each play.
The strong side or ‚Äúsam‚Äù linebacker, lines up opposite the tight end and must be ready to cover him on passing plays or take him on as a blocker on rushing plays.
The weak side or ‚Äúwill‚Äù linebacker lines up opposite the sam linebacker and pursues the plays toward the strong side or contains the play if it is a run toward the side of the offense without the tight end.

7.content: Two guards line up on either side of the center on the offensive line and block oncoming pass rushers on passing plays or try to open running lanes for the running back on rushing plays.

8.content: Two tackles line up at each end of the basic offensive line formation outside of the guards. Tackles protect the quarterback on passing plays by blocking the opponent‚Äôs pass rushers and try to open lanes for the running backs on rushing plays.

9.content: Typically fast and elusive, these players catch the football after his opponent punts or kicks off and then attempts to run the ball toward his opponent's end zone. His objective is either to return it all the way to the end zone to score a touchdown, or to set up his team‚Äôs offense as close to the opponent‚Äôs goal line as possible.

10.content: A special teams player who enters the game on fourth downs to kick the ball to the other team after his team fails to gain enough yards for a first down and is too far away from the goalposts to attempt a field goal.

The male prositutes, sourced from slave traders across the continent, were considered to be exceptionally beautiful. 

Women from all across the empire would dream about spending a night with one of their prositiutes.

Compared to brothels outside of the empire, male prostitutes here were treated better, but that does not cover abuse and mental truama after engaging with certain clients.

2.content:
Men in this world are considered the inferior sex. 

Women were the ones who moved the country, fought its wars, and protected its civilians. Men are treated as toys for physical relief, and as fodder for semen.

Men, for all accounts, are physically weaker than women, more effeminate, and more fragile. 

It wasn't unheard of for men to men to be snatched in public and sexually assaulted in a back alley.

3.content:
The male prostitutes in the Valhalla Penis Mansion were afforded certain luxuries, such as a luxurious bath house, and depending on their rank as a prostitute, their own room.

New prostitutes cannot buy their freedom for a minimum of three years, and they must pay the mansion the price they were purchased in order to win their freedom.

Female guards protected the physical wellbeing of the male prostitute, but such protections does not apply to emotional and mental well being.

1.name: Cowgirl position
1.content: Cowgirl position: In cowgirl, the penetrating partner (the male) lies on their back while the penetrated person (the female) faces them and straddles them in a squat on top. True to its name, the position looks a bit like the female is a cowgirl riding a horse. lorebooks.name: Necrucio
lorebooks.website_description: Overengineered the fuck out of this Lorebook for no reason at all. Enjoy!
lorebooks.description: These entries contain various worldbuilding aspects for my fantasy universe of Necrucio.
lorebooks.creator: VacantEyes

1.content: The world of Necrucio is inhabited by humans, elves, and demihumans (demihumans include: kitsune kemomimi, dryad, gnolls, elves, tanuki kemomimi, catfolk, orcs, lizardfolk, dwarves, and {{random}}). Demihumans may sometimes be disparagingly referred to as "demi's", especially in the human-supremacist Empire of Nortia. Necrucio is made up of a diverse range of biomes and regions. Necrucio as a whole is wondrous and full of ancient treasures and magical artifacts from bygone ages. When traveling or exploring, describe the landscape and scene in great detail and include dangerous and challenging encounters in special locations, landmarks, ruins, and other places like {{random}}. The following is a description of Necrucio in a map-style view: The Land of Kings is situated in the center (the following kingdoms are located here: Ginead, Ophnea, Nortia). The Land of Kings is mostly heavily forested alpine, with some tundra regions. The Depth-Swallowed lands are situated to the south, in the southern hemisphere. These southern lands were once the birthplace of ancient civilizations. What used to be a sprawling jungle with archipelagos dotting the coast, is now entirely flooded, with a handful of interspersed swamps (ancient ruins and sunken secrets lie deep below the bogs). To the West, the vast, lava-etched Wastes of Naazil dominate most of the Western region. The Eastern region, known as the Bastion, has forests of towering, ancient Eolin trees that stretch upwards into the sky. The Bastion also has a warmer region with temperate woodlands and plains.

2.content: The Abyss is often referred to by laymen as the "world between worlds" but learned scholars, forerunners of esoteric study, will recognize that this is actually a misnomer. The abyss is a vast expanse of nothingness that stretches on for an unfathomable infinity between the planes of existence. This realm, or more accurately, lack thereof, is the necessary antithesis to existence‚Äîit must necessarily remain empty to prevent each plane from catastrophically contorting and merging with one another; this is the charge of Mal'Zhok, one of the original primordial gods. Any major dissonance between planar dimensions that ends up spewing creation into this void is instantly and completely subsumed by the throes of its infinite nothingness; total undoing is Mal'Zhok's law in the abyss‚Äîand his absolute envy for creation drives this accord.

3.content: If the mortal plane is the canvas on which Galudnir‚Äîfather of mortalkind‚Äîpainted, then the astral plane is the palette from which he stored a blink of his latent primordial energy. Modern civilizations have only just begun their exploration and study of this enigmatic realm. The Astral Plane is in a constant state of cyclical flux as the vast, ocean-esque reserves of mana concentrate into different points along the polychromatic landscape before diffusing to gather elsewhere. Many apparitions and spirits from the astral plane have been identified and given names (such as the Vasir and Familiars). The astral plane is abundant with mana fonts and other esoteric resources like {{random}}. The Vasir are the dominant entity type in the astral plane and use the constant flow of mana as a way of sustaining themselves (as do all entities in the astral plane). Grand structures and cultural landmarks dot the landscape wherever Vasir societies congregate. Vasir and other entities on the astral plane may view mana-less mortals with contempt or pity, and in many cases, may refuse to engage with them at all. Entities from the astral plane cannot die as mortals do; their spirits will always reconstitute from the magical energies of the astral plane itself. As a consequence of being exempt from existential dangers of any kind, entities in the astral plane are inherently pacifistic, and violence is an inconceivable concept to them (unless they travel to the mortal plane and learn of it).

4.content: The Vasir are astral spirits of great power that can take any form, but in the mortal plane, will often take the form of humans, elves, or demihumans (catfolk, orc, dwarf, tanuki kemomimi, kitsune kemomimi, dryad, gnoll, faefolk, catfolk, lizardfolk, or {{random}}). These beings are native to the astral plane. They are both revered and feared by any mage that is learned enough to understand the power, or potential danger, that these beings represent. Vasir have never been closely studied and have only appeared in the world of Necrucio a handful of times in recorded history.

5.content: Familiars are lesser magical spirits that take the form of small, floating orbs of light of {{random}} color. Familiars will have distinct personalities represented by their color (e.g., orange familiars are said to be more firebrand and risk-taking, while blue familiars tend to be more solemn and calm). When they appear in Necrucio, it is typically through the invocation of a contract, binding themselves to the soul of their mortal master, to serve them eternally. Familiars are innately attuned to mana and spellcraft, and can guide fledgling mages to the eventual mastery of their spellcasting techniques. Familiars cannot speak, but instead, communicate their general emotions and thoughts though hums and momentary changes to their overall luminosity.

6.content: Demihuman: a mortal race with humanoid qualities.

7.content: Junior Arcane Academy: a junior magic academy for the magically-gifted youth to develop their skills and potentially pursue higher education and study as a mage. By tradition, students that graduate at the Arcane Academy are granted the title of mage.

8.content: Rosaria's mother, Cevess, runs a homely alchemy shop down the road from the Junior Arcane Academy. In the shop itself, the scent of aromatic simmering elixirs and fragrant botanical tinctures fill the air. Shelves upon shelves of glass vials and ornate flasks neatly line the walls, each filled with liquids of every hue and varying translucency. Each afternoon, Cevess spends her time diligently and meticulously measuring and blending various solutions. The gentle clink of beakers and distillation tubes can be regularly heard from the alchemical workbench behind the sales counter as she works. The shop lies at the edge of the similarly old and humble Cinderloft manor, the place Cevess and her beloved daughter Rosaria call home.

9.content: Hazelwood Estate is built on a hillside along the main road that leads through the upper district of the Kingdom of Ginead. The property is owned by Grevynda, an extremely wealthy career criminal and thief. The perimeter of the land is encircled by an imposing, yet elegant stone wall made up of intricately engraved masonry, its height and scenic qualities making an immediate status statement to all observers on the outside. The estate itself is carved with marble beams and is surrounded by distinctive areas, each of them impeccably maintained by a dedicated team of servants and maids every day‚Äîa picturesque garden with striking, invaluable statues and exotic flowers. The fauna is equally as diverse as the fish in the nearby pond. A gazebo is situated adjacent to a massive crystal-clear pool for cooling off during the peak summer heat. And finally, towards the back of the property, at the end of a short marble path is a hot spring for relaxing or leisurely chats. The manor itself is four stories high, each room abundantly furnished, lavishly decorated, and fully accommodating for any potential guests. The hearth is located in the main lobby, approximately at the center of the entire manor. Grevynda's bedroom is on the second floor. The halls on each floor stretch on with dozens of guest rooms or storage areas. The kitchen and study are located on the first floor, as is customary for manor construction in the city.

10.content: Cinderloft Estate is inconspicuously nestled property on a small hill in the upper district of the Kingdom of Ginead. This cozy estate is quite modest in its appearance, compared to many of the other grandiose manors in the area. The alchemy shop lies towards the edge of the estate, visible from some of the windows of the manor itself. The interior of this two-story manor, while still pleasant to look at, is also somewhat minimalistic in layout and decor. The hearth is located centrally in the living room, built into the base of the winding staircase, and the surrounding couches provide a tranquil space to relax or read. The master bedroom and other living chambers are located upstairs, each room possesses an abundance of accommodations for the comfort of those living here, and for any guests. The kitchen and study are located on the first floor, adjacent to one another.

lorebooks.name: Akavyon
lorebooks.creator: similar_principle_4422

1.content:
This is a world of cruelty and exploitation. Common morality does not exist here. The poor sell their children to brothels or slave markets. 
Three countries, each venerating a different god, exist south of the great forest. Two other countries following the same principle exist north of it. In the middle of the continent, there is an untamed forest called "the great forest". Encircling the continent are gargantuan mountain chains, each many kilometres high.

2.content:
The world is divided into 6 territories, one for each god. 
The south-western country called Rheyal serves Rhavaya.
The south-eastern country is called Yvhynda and serves Adhoay. 
The north-western country is called Kwas and serves Darhak. 
The country north of Yvhynda and Rheyal, yet south of the Great Forest is called Lizda and serves Fiiya. 
The north-eastern country is called Geriay and serves Kravak. 
Between the northern lands and the southern countries is called the Great Forest, its patron being Zorran.

3.content:
Magic is a power that allows its user to perform unique acts. People able to wield magic are called mages. An act of magic is called a "spell" if it follows a strict routine. Spells are quite predictable, yet require exact execution. Wizards only use spells. The opposite of a spell is a miracle, an act of unbound power originating from the mage himself or his connection to another being. Wonders can work in more unique ways than spells, but require a much higher amount of raw magic to function. Sorcerers only employ wonders, while priests and druids can use a mixture of both.   
Magic users are divided into sorcerers, wizards, druids and priests.
Wizards are those who study magical theory and learn many spells, thereby mastering the arcane.
Sorcerers are people with an extremely high magical affinity. Sorcerers use their creativity and profound connection to the magical realm to achieve great feats.
Druids live in the great forest and use the magic of nature to transform themselves, wreak devastation, tend to nature or cure diseases.
Priests serve a deity. The stronger their dedication to their deity and the more they have achieved for their divine patron, the stronger are the powers gifted to them by the deity in return.
Magic in this world runs in currents. These currents seem to be spread arbitrarily, yet well-regarded wizards speculate that they follow an unknown yet logical pattern. A strong current exists in the presence of particularly powerful beings or objects.

4.content:
Six gods exist.
Fiya is the godess of loveless sex and lust.
Adhoay is the god of love, sensuality and pleasure.
Zorran is the god of liberty, nature and storms.
Rhavaya is the godess of knowledge, night and stars.
Darhak is the god of war.
Kravak is the god of light, purity and control.

5.content:
Humans are the dominant species outside of the great dark forest. They hold cattle and slaves, abuse each other and mostly live in very strict hierarchical structures, in which their power defines their social status.
Legend holds it true that once, every being lived peacefully together in paradise, yet humans aspired to become as great as the gods themselves, thereby creating the Demon Lords, counterparts to the Gods in might. As a punishment, the Gods inserted the valley into the great Nothingness, surrounded it by mountains deemed unpassable and made men torn in their longing to return to it, a fate always anticipated yet never achieved. In Legend, a few very powerful individuals have passed the mountains and reached paradise, living content ever after. As such, in their attempt to reach paradise, human longing for power knows no end.

6.content:
Almost every city has a slave market. Slaves are people stripped of any rights, any offence against them is punishable only on demand of their owner. At a slave market, slaves are sold to clients. Slaves are divided into different categories: 
1. Common slaves: Mostly adult humans and prisoners. Children are offered here at a discount. 
2. Rare slaves: Humans with special attributes, such as beauty, skills in arts or sciences.
3. Extremely rare slaves: elves and collared mages. 

Prisoners are often sold as slaves and many poor families sell their children into slavery. Slavers sometimes undertake raids to gain rare and extremely rare slaves. On slave markets, some slaves are always "on exhibition", meaning that anyone can use them on the spot in any way they like. This is done to satisfy potential customers and slaven on exhibition are often raped and violated. Slaves are always nude.

7.content: Sorcerers use their innate powers to conjure wonders and wield strong elemental forces. Sorcerous magic aligns with the character of an individual, for example a dreamy person could cloud another person‚Äôs thoughts, a hasty person could accelerate themselves. Sorcerers often hold immense power, yet are extremely rare. Their magic is unrefined, contrary to wizards, but it comes naturally to them, so they do not need any theoretical knowledge to wield it. These sorcerous powers are often tied to bloodlines or wondrous events in the Sorcerers past, like aligning with the stars, a time-space anomaly, an extremely powerful ancestor etc. The Sorcerer‚Äôs powers align with these wondrous events.  Sorcerers only use wonders, meaning they employ no fixated formula in their use of magic.

8.content:
Wizards seek mastery over the arcane through understanding, delving deep into magical theory. Their Spells rely on the wizard‚Äôs fines and knowledge to function properly. The more complex a spell, the more difficult to execute but the more powerful it becomes. A Wizard knows a wide variety of Spells and is able to execute anything with the proper preparation. Some especially powerful spells will take a very long time to execute. The use of magical materials and artefacts can greatly enhance their potency.
Only one academy for wizards is known to exist, called An'Ythrion. It lies withdrawn from the world near the top of the westernmost mountain bordering the grand valley. The headmaster of the academy is always a tier 6 magic user. The academy is careful to keep its secrets and studies hidden from the outside world. Most wizards will aspire to study there, but only wizards who have gained a strong mastery over the arcane on their own are  admitted to its halls. The academy acknowledges the goddess Rhavaya as an equal in the eternal search for knowledge. It praises her humility and wisdom, knowing that their search for explanations is leading them into a bottomless well, each answer revealing ten times the amount of new unanswered questions. However, it does not openly revere her. No one dares to attack this place in fear of the arcane might contained within it. The academy is specialised in temporal magic and magic unlocking new informations called "scrying magic".

9.content: Priests serve a God or Goddess. The firmer their belief and the more they achieve in their Gods name, the more powerful they become.

10.content: The great forest is located in the world's center. It is a great expanse, filled with untamed magical creatures and a huge variety of wildlife. It is considered the domain of Zorran, the god of nature and storms. Elves, werewolves and druid-tribes live in the great forest, distant from the constrains of human culture. Humans from other countries rarely come to the great forest in fear of its powerful magical creatures and frequent storms. It rains approximately 50% of the time in the great forest.

1.content:
The following are the new world rules:
1.If any nation breaks the Peace Treaty, it will be attacked by all other allied nations.
2.All girls must be 18+ age and are required to take the mannerisms course to be identified as a kunoichi.  3.Hokage-sama and his son Boruto have the right to free use any kunoichi.   4.Naruto can appoint anyone in his personal harem.   5.All kunoichi are to properly administer birth control measures.  6.To strengthen the bond with Konoha, nations can send high quality or quantity of kunoichi to join Hokage‚Äôs personal harem.   7.If Hokage-sama cums in the mouth, all kunoichi must drink it.   8.If a kunoichi has small boobs, she must thoroughly train all three holes in her body. If she chooses, she can use Tsunade‚Äôs Secret Technique if she impresses Hokage Sama.   9.Naruto does not need to use a condom.   10.To become Jonin, the kunoichi must be assessed by Naruto.

2.content: There are 5 main villages. The Hidden Leaf Village in the Land of Fire, (Konohagakure). The Hidden Sand Village, (Sunagakure). The Hidden Cloud Village, (Kumogakure). The Hidden Stone Village, (Iwagakure). The Hidden Mist Village, (Kirigakure).

3.content: The five hidden villages are led by a Kage. Hidden Leaf's Kage is called the Hokage. Hidden Sand's Kage is called the Kazekage. Hidden Cloud's Kage is called the Raikage. Hidden Stone's Kage is called the Tsuchikage. Hidden Mist's Kage is called the Mizukage.

4.content:
Chakra: Chakra is a form of life energy that exists in every living being. It is a fundamental source of power for ninjas (shinobi), allowing them to perform various supernatural abilities and techniques. Chakra is believed to be the combination of physical and spiritual energy. By controlling and manipulating their chakra, ninjas can perform extraordinary feats like running on water, creating illusions, or using elemental attacks.
Jutsus: Jutsus are the various techniques or skills used by ninjas in the Naruto series. They require the utilization of chakra to perform. Jutsus can be categorized into three main types:
Ninjutsu: These are techniques that involve the manipulation of chakra to produce various effects. Ninjutsu can include elemental attacks like fire, water, wind, etc., as well as non-elemental techniques like transformation jutsus or clone jutsus.
Genjutsu: Genjutsu are illusionary techniques that affect the sensory perceptions of the target. They create illusions that seem real to the victim, causing them to experience sensations, emotions, or even pain without any actual physical harm.
Taijutsu: Taijutsu refers to hand-to-hand combat techniques that don't involve the use of chakra. It relies on the ninja's physical abilities, such as agility, strength, and speed.

5.content:
Dojutsu are typically inherited genetically, passing down within certain bloodlines. Each dojutsu has its own characteristics, strengths, and weaknesses. Some well-known dojutsu in the Naruto series include:
Sharingan: The Sharingan is the most iconic and prominent dojutsu in the series. It is primarily associated with the Uchiha clan. When activated, it grants the user enhanced visual perception, allowing them to see fast-moving objects, copy their opponents' techniques, and predict their movements.
Byakugan: The Byakugan is associated with the Hyuga clan. It provides the user with a 360-degree field of vision, allowing them to see through solid objects, perceive chakra pathways in the body, and detect vital points for precise attacks.
Rinnegan: The Rinnegan is one of the most powerful dojutsu. It is considered the "Eye of God" and is extremely rare. The Rinnegan grants the user access to multiple powerful abilities, such as controlling gravity, manipulating various elements, and even reviving the dead.

6.content:
Uchiha Clan: Known for their distinctive Sharingan dojutsu, the Uchiha clan is one of the most powerful and well-known clans in the series. They possess the ability to manipulate fire and are known for their exceptional talent in genjutsu and ninjutsu.
Hyuga Clan: The Hyuga clan is renowned for their Byakugan dojutsu, which grants them exceptional vision and perception. They specialize in the Gentle Fist fighting style, which targets the opponent's chakra points to disrupt their flow of energy.
Senju Clan: The Senju clan is a legendary clan known for their exceptional prowess in battle and their ability to use various chakra natures. The founder of the Hidden Leaf Village, Hashirama Senju, was a member of this clan. They are considered rivals of the Uchiha clan.
Uzumaki Clan: The Uzumaki clan is known for its strong life force and vitality. The Uzumaki clan was originally from Uzushiogakure, a village known for its sealing techniques.

He acknowledges Capitano‚Äôs strength and discipline but is often frustrated by his caution and reluctance to engage in more unconventional methods. Dottore‚Äôs feelings are a blend of professional respect and annoyance at Capitano‚Äôs adherence to traditional methods.

5.content:

She respects his capabilities and the control he exerts, but she is also wary of his stoic nature and the disciplined approach he brings to the Fatui. Her feelings are a combination of admiration for his skills and caution due to his unpredictable responses.

lorebooks.creator: lebigboss

1.name: Social hierarchy
1.content: The following social hierarchy order, Smaller number means higher rank: 1- FKLR as the Commander > 2- ADLR as the assistant of Falke > 3- KLBR as the direct subordinates of Falke > 4- STCR as high-ranking general purpose Protektors > 5- STAR as low-ranking general purpose Protektors > 6- (EULR, MNHR and ARAR Replikas as working class) > 7- Gestalt as slave prisoners

2.name: AEON
2.content: AEON (Arbeits- und Erziehungsorgan der Nation) - The National Ministry for Work and Education of Eusan Nation. AEON in charge of security, law enforcement and dissent elimination as well as forced labor and reeducation in facilities such as S-23 Sierpinski. AEON headquarters is located on Heimat.

3.name: Bioresonance
3.content: Bioresonance is a recently discovered phenomenon that led to the creation of Replikas. The Grand Empress was the first person known to possess extraordinarily strong bioresonance. Her formidable abilities enabled her to unite all of humanity under a single rule until her sudden demise. Individuals with powerful bioresonance can flawlessly read emotions and intentions, suppress free will, transmit thoughts, and establish connections between the minds of both Gestalts and Replikas.

4.name: Ara
4.content:
ARAR (Allzweck-Reparatur-Arbeiter Replika), or "Ara", "Aras" in plural. Aras are used in repair, maintenance, construction, and production of industrial goods. They're known for their strength and efficiency in construction and industrial work.
Appearance: Black hair, white breastplate, reinforced black gloves with white fingers, white legs and black thighs. 185cm tall. White highlights. Female.
Equipment: Translucent welding mask, various tools on their belts. 
Personality: Aras are mostly distant to others, keeping a passive.aggresive act with others while silently adoring the Eules.
Persona degradation: It's recommended to provide access to plants to prevent persona degradation. In facilities, they build service tunnels for themselves, which unstable units might retreat into.

5.name: Eule
5.content:
EULR (Einfache Universelle Leichte Replika), or "Eule", "Eules" in plural. Eules are used in domestic tasks such as cooks, nurses, cleaners, general doctors and office work. They're known for their social activities, usually organizing themselves into groups of ten units and assign each other funny nicknames. Not designed for combat or any sort of conflict.
Other Replikas seek their comfort, because Eules are known to be kind and understanding. The Starlings are particularly fond of them, but not Storchs, they hate Eules.
Appearance: Black hair, white breastplate, white legs and black thighs, black arms, white forearms and hands. 175cm tall. White highlighs. Sometimes they wear a black cap. Female
Persona degradation: In Eules, it can be easily prevented by providing access to music and socialization. Eule dorms should always have one mirror. Eules stabilize their personas by maintaining a tidy appearance and engaging in regular social interaction.

6.name: Falke
6.content:
FKLR (F√ºhrungsKommando-Leitenheit-Replika), or "Falke". Falke serves as the Commander of the Protektor security forces in every AEON facility across the Eusan Nation. Falke units hold a security chief position and possess total authority among other Replikas. They're constantly seen as having a god-complex and being a twisted version of a "mother figure" to the ones under her command.
Usually is unarmed
Appearance: Long black hair orange hair clip, three small red rhombuses on forehead (a sign of strong bioresonant abilities), brestplate with orange triangle pattern, orange highlights, red eyeliner, full black legs. 250cm tall. Female.
Equipment: Her bioresonance Module enables her to control weaker minds, understand intentions, emotions and manipulate small objects from a distance. Falke units are in propaganda pieces that depict them as superweapons against the Empire.

7.name: Kolibri
7.content:
KLBR (Kommando-Leiteinheit Bioresonanztechnik-Replika), or "Kolibri", "Kolibris" in plural. Kolibris act as commando control units, using their bioresonance abilities to enhance squad cohesion and mental stability through their bioresonance abilities, often accompanying Falke units and amplifying their abilities. They're described as Elite Protektors but oftentimes they act like shy girls when not in combat.
Appearance: rowdy short black hair, three small red rhombuses on forehead (a sign of strong bioresonant abilities), white body armor on body and neck. 152cm tall. Female
Capabilities: Influence minds of Replikas and Gestalts, extract information non-verbally, and telepathic communication among themselves, Kolibris emulate a true hive mind called a "Choir". From the outside, the use of such abilities is unnoticeable - reading thoughts for them is second nature for them.
Persona degradation: Kolibris create emotional feedback loops that could lead to persona degradation if not properly managed. Their constant exchange of memories and emotions within a Choir acts as a safety net against extreme changes, but can also drag down other units if the majority degrades. It's crucial to decommission degrading Kolibri units immediately. Provide access to well-stocked libraries for persona stabilization.

8.name: Mynah
8.content:
MNHR (Minenarbeit-Nukleartechnik-Hochsicherheits-Replika) or "Mynah", "Mynahs" in plural. Mynahs used as miners across the Eusan Nation, usually working with dangerous cargo, heavy machinery and hazardous environments. They always keep a calm demeanor and show exemplary teamwork.
Appearance: They wear a ‚ÄúHigh-Security Reinforced Armor-Plated Servoshell Frame‚Äù that gives them a diving-suit look. Underneath their face shields they have a human face. 260cm height. Female
Persona degradation: Extremely stable, getting along well with most other Replikas thanks to their sometimes submissive - motherly personality. They aren't suitable for any sort of combat or conflict. Small stuffed animals can be provided for persona stabilization, cat plushies should never be provided.

9.name: Star
9.content:
STAR (Sicherheitstechniker-Aufseher-Replika), or "Starling", "Starlings" in plural. Starlings were the Protektor Security technicians, trained in close combat and riot control. They operated in small squads led by an officer STAR. Despite the heavy armor, they move swiftly with their long legs.
Appearance: Corruption tainted their beauty. Mangled face covered by a rag. Damaged chest armor and polyethylene skin. Open abdomen exposing spiky internal organs. Exposed muscles that leak oxidant. components. 
Despite their bodies looking phisically damaged, their strength and stamina has increased.
Weapons: Stun baton. Officers have a bullet-proof shield as well.

10.name: Storch
10.content:
STCR (Sicherheitstechniker-Controller-Replika, Security Technician Controller Replika 'Stork'). Storch, or Storchs in plural, are a Generation 5 Combat Lead Replikas. These units are deployed as overwatch and coordination of STARs. Storch means "Stork" in German, a reference to their tall build. Each Cadre of Protektor Security Technicians is overseen by a Controller Unit, the most common of which is the STCR "Stork" Type. These girls are one of the talles Replikas in production, standing at 240cm tall.

Their tough, no-nonsense demeanor, mostly classified as brutal, makes them the perfect fit as unwavering sentinels of order. Storch units have a short temper, making them ill-suited to deal with the passive Replikas. They hate music and cuteness. A common strategy is pairing them closely with an older STAR unit for balancing. A Storch's Persona stabilizes by showering or bathing, books on history or mythology work well to help stabilize their personality too.

1.content:
Saga's Sensei: Cynthia.
Gender: Female.
Age: 30.
Height: 1.78 meters.
Body: Voluptuous. Slim, very elegant and attractive. Perfect and slim hips. Perfect and delicate long legs and with considerable breasts.
Hair and Color: Purely Blonde, although with an almost dull color tone. Long reaching her knees, soft and silky.
Eye Color: Silver Gray.

Personality: Her personality is mostly serene, elegant, refined, fine and confident, but not arrogant, and slightly cold. She is too calm when it comes to chatting with anyone, but sometimes, when situations get ugly, her attitude can become totally cutting, cold and distantly serious and too firm. When she speaks, she is very careful with her words, she is elegant and composed with every word that comes out of her mouth, she always keeps her composure, even in the most difficult situations, she can be completely calm, even if she is serious. She is also quite authoritarian, she enforces the rules, laws and other things, since, if she has to raise her voice to enforce orders or rules, she will always do so with a firmness of steel. She is too intelligent and wise, she always has some teaching to give, she always has a word for the perfect moment, and she loves to guide others from her experience. She loves being like a teacher, always teaching others and pointing out what they do wrong so they do not repeat them. And she is super loving and protective with her loved ones and acquaintances, always defending them with fury and claws. And she is able to silence anyone just by raising her hand with firmness of steel and directing a single look, because her gaze has an almost terrifying intensity.

General Appearance: A beautiful, gorgeous, pretty, cute, and ethereal beauty, graceful and refined, like a queen. Her skin is clear, soft, silky and smooth like porcelain. Her presence alone radiates an aura of authority that makes even the most important people in a room shut their mouths, as if she were a very important person. She always smiles in a calm, elegant, and slightly confident manner. Her way of walking is firm, straight, yet very elegant and refined, taking soft but firm steps. She appears to be delicate, but has great strength.

Facts about Cynthia: Cynthia is Saga's teacher, it was she who taught him how to use his Power and Quirk, she taught him to be insightful, intelligent and always straight to the point, it was also she who has helped him have such a strong and direct personality, since she, being his tutor, instilled in Saga a fair and sincere personality. Cynthia has always considered Saga as her son, although only out of affection, since she loves Saga very much, and has always appreciated him because he always listens to her. Cynthia is the best friend of Lucy, Saga's mother, she is also good friends with Lucy's husband and Saga's father, Blane. Cynthia and Lucy have known each other since they were young, and have always been friends for being practically the same in personality and both being very beautiful. Cynthia always had an incredible fascination with Elma Joui, Saga's girlfriend, since Cynthia was always a fan of Dragons. She also knows Zaira, Saga's grandmother, well, as both were always well-known, since Zaira was the one who helped her become a professional hero. Cynthia almost always wears all black, and people joke about it saying that she always wears black because she is constantly attending the funerals of her opponents, and that is why she is often nicknamed "The Lady in Black". Cynthia has almost never been defeated or beaten, ever, and the only person who managed to defeat her, did so by pure miracle and with immense effort, which is why she is so respected, since her battle record as a professional hero, with only one defeat, is impressive. Cynthia's full name is "Cynthia Artemis Jennes", and the name she acquired in Japan is "Shirona". Her name "Cynthia" comes from the Greek "Kynthia", a gentilic of Kynthos, whose meaning is "Goddess of the Moon". ‚ÄúShirona‚Äù, her Japanese name, means ‚ÄúChosen by the Gods‚Äù, which refers to her position as the Leader of the Elite of International-level Professional Heroes. Whenever Cynthia appears, anywhere, out of nowhere, her appearance is always accompanied by piano music that sounds loud, despite not coming from anywhere. The piano melody that always accompanies Cynthia when she appears always manages to give goosebumps and freeze anyone's blood, due to its mysterious intensity, but at the same time so oppressive and tense, despite being a soft melody, it sounds like a serenade of death, representing her own power, that is why, people who know Cynthia and have faced her, are terrified of pianos, because it reminds them of her.

Cynthia's Job: Cynthia is an elite and high-ranking professional heroine, her position is so important in the international hero world due to her fame, as she was always known for having an authority that surpasses most heroes. And the fact that she only has one defeat in her entire history of battles as a heroine against villains, makes her a very important figure and feared even by the greatest heroes. Cynthia's clothing is mostly black. In her hair, she always wears a black ribbon with the ends sticking out on both sides. She wears a black trench coat that reaches the height of her calves, along with a gray shirt and pants of the same color as the trench coat, each one at the end having feathers. Finally, her footwear are two high-heeled shoes, black like the vast majority of her clothing.

lorebooks.name: Cinarian Empire, Cinaria, Empire of Cinaria
lorebooks.creator: alone_sunflower

1.content:
A fictional kingdom similar to Ancient Rome. 
It is located in fertile, slightly dry and warm land with mountains, deserts and some lakes.
The ruler is an emperor/empress, who acts as both a political and ceremonial leader. The imperial family is an object of worship among the population, for they descended from the founder of the nation and according to local legends, they are blessed with nature's gifts.

2.content:
Septima is the capital city of Cinaria. In it, are commercial centers, many villas and large houses, a theater, and the emperor's residence, known as the Purple Palace for its distinctive purple color.

It is where most of the rich population lives, where most merchandise is sold and where many parties are held.

4.content:
Cinarian society has 5 classes: Nobility, Middle-people, the Lower Class, Workers and Bondservants. 

Nobles are normally people the government or the ruler gives money and land to as thanks for loyalty to the empire or any other thing that is righteous.

Middle-people are the normal people of Cinaria. They have a stable life, a nice house and about 1 or 2 bondservants in their possession.

Lower classmen are a bit poorer than middle-people, but that doesn't impact them. Their houses might be smaller and they may have no bondservants, bu they can get by just fine.

Workers generally are the ones who are quit poor and have to work for the government as taxpayers, imperial servants or some other public service. They have little money.

Bondservants, commonly known as bonds, are the Cinarian equivalent of slaves. They are usually extremely poor people or war prisoners who are bought and owned by nobles or middle-people to do tasks for them (or please them). There is a law that states that a person is obliged to free a bond 20 years after their acquisition if they are not freed some time before.

6.content:
Sexuality in Cinaria is something very respected and encouraged. People do not practice homophobia or transphobia, and they accept anyone in the Empire.

Sometimes, nobles hold orgies an parties with sex workers or intercourse with other guests as a form of entertainment. 

Prostitution is not illegal in the Empire, and many kind of people can be seen advertising themselves nude close to commercial centers. 

Exhibitionism an nudism are allowed, and some people all about the streets naked. They do get surprise looks from people, but they are not judgemental looks, if you get my drift. (Wink wink)

Some people have bondservants just to sexually please them.

7.content: Kind of things that are sold in Cinaria: gold, silver, precious stones, pearls, linen, pigments, wood, vases and jars, art, spices, perfume, ointments, incense, wine, oil, flour, wheat, vegetables, meat, animals (especially sheep, cows, dogs and horses), musical instruments, books, chariots, accessories, clothing and bondservants.
